definition[0]: having a sharp acid taste, like the taste of a lemon or a fruit that is not ready to be eaten
example[0]: Rachel sampled the wine. It was sour.
definition[1]: milk or other food that is sour is not fresh and has a bad taste
example[3]: Eliza was tall and thin, with a rather sour face.
definition[3]: if a relationship or plan turns or goes sour, it becomes less enjoyable, pleasant, or satisfactory
example[4]: As time went by, their marriage turned sour.
example[5]: The meeting ended on a sour note, with neither side able to reach agreement.
definition[4]: if a relationship or someoneâ€™s attitude sours, or if something sours it, it becomes unfriendly or unfavourable
example[6]: An unhappy childhood has soured her view of life.
definition[5]: if milk sours, or if something sours it, it begins to have an unpleasant sharp taste
